body_content.explanation: a unit for measuring a computer’s speed, equal to approximately one thousand billion (= 1,000,000,000,000), or a trillion, operations (= processes) per second:
examples: The processor has a peak performance of 34 trillion floating-point calculations a second, or 34 teraflops.
This new product utilizes advanced GDDR5 memory and a 1 GHz clock speed to deliver 1.6 TeraFLOPs of computing power.
